Actor.HealthMaxMonster: Max HP. Set to zero to autocalculate max HP from hit dice.
Actor.Title: Title
Actor.ClassHint:
Class can be selected by manually typing the class name or drag/droppping the class item onto the character sheet. It is possible to type any value, but class data will only be synched if the class name matches exactly.

Click label to view class sheet.
Actor.THBonusHint: Used with ascending armor class (AAC) system, this value is added to attack rolls. Also called attack bonus. To-Hit Bonus is auto-calculated based on THAC0 value.
Actor.moraleHint: The morale score indicates a character's or monster's loyalty and courage.
Actor.retainerMoraleHint: The morale score of this character's retainers. A retainer's morale score indicates their loyalty and courage under this character's leadership.

enchanted.name: Enchanted
enchanted.hint: This enchanted creature can only be hit by magical weapons or spells.

castAs.name: Cast As
castAs.hint: Some monsters can cast spells that are equivelent of a specific class and level. Specify as class key and level, similar to save as. Example: A monster that can cast spells as a 9th level Magic-User would have a castAs value of 'M9'.

classAbilityAs.name: Class Abl. As
classAbilityAs.hint: Some monsters have the class abilities of a specific class and level. Specify as class key and level, similar to save as. Example: A monster with 2nd level thief class abilities would have a class ability as of 'T2'.

hdConBonus.name: HD Con.
hdConBonus.hint: Character's Constitution modifier is added to the hit die roll.

maxLevel.hint: The highest level this class can attain.
maxLevel.name: Max Level

maxSpellLevel.hint: The highest spell level for this class.
maxSpellLevel.name: Max Spell Level

firstLevel.hint: The lowest level for this class.
firstLevel.name: First Level

isRetainer.hint: Is this character a retainer, NPC, hireling or other hired hand.
isRetainer.name: Retainer

Flight.hint: Secondary movement can be any other type of movement the creature is capable of besides ground movement.

Movement.turnHint:
Feet or yards per turn.

This rate includes many assumed actions such as mapping, peeking around corners, resting, and so forth.
Movement.roundHint:
Feet or yards per round.

Used during combat encounters.
Movement.dayHint:
Miles per day. Overland travel.

Note that terrain effects this rate.
Movement.runHint:
Feet or yards per round.

Used when moving at maximum speed during combat encounters.

Abilities.base: Base ability score: This is the ability score as it was rolled.
Abilities.tempMod: This is a manually entered temporary modifier to the ability score.

str.hint:
Strength (Str) represents a character's physical power.

It influences the damage dealt with melee weapons like swords and clubs, as well as thrown weapons like spears and knives. It also impacts the character's accuracy when using hand-to-hand weapons and determines their capability for tasks like forcing open locked doors.

Click label to roll ability check. Ctrl-click to roll without modifier.

dex.hint:
Dexterity (Dex) is the character's nimbleness and grace.

It affects the character's ability to wield missile and thrown weapons (such as bows and throwing knives) and can make it harder for enemies to hit the character.

Click label to roll ability check. Ctrl-click to roll without modifier.

int.hint:
Intelligence (Int) is the character's mental might.

It affects the number of languages the character can learn.

Click label to roll ability check. Ctrl-click to roll without modifier.

wis.hint:
Wisdom (Wis) is the character's understanding.

It affects the character's strength in understanding the world, the way things work, the forces of nature, and so forth, including their natural ability to resist magical spells.

Click label to roll ability check. Ctrl-click to roll without modifier.

con.hint:
Constitution (Con) is the character's physical health and vigor.

It affects the character's hit points score (i.e., his ability to survive being injured).

Click label to roll ability check. Ctrl-click to roll without modifier.

cha.hint:
Charisma (Cha) is the character's force of personality and presence.

It affects the way other characters, especially nonplayer characters controlled by the DM, react to the character.

Click label to roll ability check. Ctrl-click to roll without modifier.

Deaths.name: Deaths
Deaths.desc:
Number of times this character has dropped to zero or less hit points.

In some variants, this is capped at a value equal to the character's constitution score.

AT#Recv.descM: Number of monster/missile attacks received this round.
AT#Recv.descH: Number of handheld attacks received this round.

unencumbered.label: Unencumbered
unencumbered.desc: Free to move without any hindrance.

lightly.label: Lightly Encumbered
lightly.desc: Slightly burdened, movement is still easy.

moderately.label: Moderately Encumbered
moderately.desc: Noticeable weight, movement is somewhat restricted. Half movement rate.

heavily.label: Heavily Encumbered
heavily.desc: Struggling under weight, movement is laborious.

sizes.THint: Creatures less than 2 feet tall, such as pixies, sprites, and giant rats.
sizes.SHint: Creatures between 2 and under 4 feet tall, such as kobolds and goblins. In standard combat mechanics, this size includes all smaller sizes.
sizes.MHint: Creatures between 4 and under 7 feet tall, such as humans, elves, and orcs.
sizes.LHint: Creatures between 7 and under 12 feet tall, such as ogres, trolls, and large beasts. In standard combat mechanics, this size includes all larger sizes.
sizes.GHint: Creatures between 12 and under 25 feet tall, such as frost giants and rocs.
sizes.IHint: Creatures 25 feet tall or larger, such as dragons, titans, and colossal creatures.

Spell.resetSlots: Reset memorized spells to zero casts. Memorized count will not be changed.
Spell.cast: Spell has been cast this many times
Spell.memorized: Spell has been memorized this many times
Spell.durationFormulaHint: The effect's duration in rounds. An infinity symbol indicates an infinite duration. A zero indicates an instantaneous effect with no duration.

isUsable.name: Usable
isUsable.hint: Specify if item can be used, which will also enable usage tracking for the item.

isTreasure.hint: Specify if the item counts as treasure when calculating encumbrance.

weight.desc: Encumbrance is the weight of an object measured in coin-weight.

light.radiusHint: Radius is the radius of the dim part of the light.
light.brightHint: Bright is the radius of the central bright part of the light.
light.durationHint: How long the light source lasts before expiring.
light.secondsRemainingHint: How many seconds this light will last.
light.turnsRemainingHint: How many turns this light will last.
light.colorHint: This is the color of the light as an HTML Color value. eg., #d0a750.
light.noFuel: {actor} has no lighting fuel or items of the required type.

setVsCharge.label: Set
setVsCharge.desc: Indicates if this weapon can be used to set vs. charge.

grip.label: Grip
grip.hint: How many hands are used to attack with the weapon.

damage.long2: Two-Handed Damage Roll. Only if weapon can be used one-handed, otherwise use damage roll field.

ammo.typeHint: The type of ammunition this item is. Leave blank is if this is not ammunition.

Armor.hintBase:
Base Armor Class

This is the base armor class and it doesn't' include modifiers from effects.
Armor.hintTotal:
Total Armor Class

This is the total armor class and it includes modifiers from effects.
Armor.hintRangedAC:
Ranged Armor Class

The effective armor class versus missile attacks.

natural.desc: This is considered a natural part of its owner.

Skill.bonusHint: A roll bonus for having the skill.
Skill.penaltyHint: A roll penalty for not having the skill.

Mastery.acBonusTypeHint: The type of attack to which the AC (or other) bonus applies.

trainingFails.name: Training
trainingFails.hint: The number of failed attempts to reach the next level. Advancement to the next mastery level is not automatic; however, each subsequent attempt increases the probability of success.

SpecialAbility.autoSuccessHint: Automatically succeeds on a natural/unmodified roll of this value.
SpecialAbility.autoFailHint: Automatically fails on a natural/unmodified roll of this value.
SpecialAbility.saveTypeHint: Set this if this special ability is a saving throw.

key.name: Key
key.hint: The key used for single-letter references to a class. Example for a Fighter would be 'F'.
The key used for refering to this item. Can be one or more characters in length and should not include any special characters.

addStatusEffect.name: Status Effect
addStatusEffect.hint: If checked, the condition will be added as a status effect.

Tags.desc: Some tags are used by the system and others are meant for GM or player usage.

notification.selectTarget: A targetted must first be selected.
notification.selectToken1: A token must first be selected.
notification.spellSelectToken: You must have your token selected to cast a spell.
notification.notMemorized: {actorName} tries to cast {spellName}, but the spell is not memorized.
notification.noTokenWarning: You must select a token or assign a default character to perform this action.
notification.noTokenWarning2: You must select a token to perform this action.
notification.missingItem: The required item type ({type}) was not found or its quantity is zero.
notification.zeroQuantity: {itemName} has a quantity of zero and can't be used.
notification.needRest: The party is tired and needs to rest.
notification.needRestSoon: The party will need to rest next turn, or their attack and damage rolls may be penalized until they do.
notification.timeReset1: Resetting session turn count to zero.
notification.timeReset2: Resetting global turn count to zero.

damageRoll.name: Damage
damageRoll.restoredLife: {tokenName} has been restored to life.

combatTracker.initRerolled: Round {round} started. Initiative rerolled for all combatants.
combatTracker.initHeld: Round {round} started. Initiative held for all combatants.

Chat.applyDamageDesc: Apply damage to selected token or target.
Chat.applyHealingDesc: Apply healing to selected token or target.
Chat.resetSpells: {actorName} reset memorized spells. Cast counts set to zero.
Chat.targetACDefMastery: {acTotal}/{defenseMasteryTotal}{targetRangedAc}
Chat.targetAC: {acTotal}{targetRangedAc}

playerCombat.title: Player Combat
playerCombat.prompt: Select combat manuever for this round.
playerCombat.instructions: Input will be disabled if character rolls initiative. This form will close automatically when combat is ended or user's combatant is removed from the combat tracker.
playerCombat.noDeclaredActions: Fantastic Depths is not configured to use declared actions.

turnTracker.conditionHint: When the party needs rest, they will be given the specified condition. The condition will be removed upon resting. This requires that all party members be added to the party tracker, otherwise the system can't determine which characters to apply the condition to.
turnTracker.turnsHint: Configure how often a party must rest while exploring. A value of 6 would mean the party must rest once every six turns. Set to 0 for no resting required.

shove.result15: The defender is shoved 15 feet and must save vs. Paralysis at -4 or fall prone.
shove.result10: The defender is shoved 10 feet and must save vs. Paralysis at -2 or fall prone.
shove.title: Shove - Defender Resist Value

spellcast.title: Cast Spell?
spellcast.content: Do you want to cast the spell or only view its description?

useItem.title: Use item?
useItem.content: Do you want to use the item or only view its description?

dialog.confirmInitiativeRoll: One or more combatants have Nothing as their declared action. Rolling the group's initiative will freeze the declared actions. Are you sure you want to proceed with rolling the group's initiative?
dialog.noEquippedWeapons: The selected actor does not have any weapons equipped.

specialAbilities.title: Add special abilities?
specialAbilities.content: Would you like to automatically add the related special abilities from {type} {name}?

AttackTypes.name: Attack Type
AttackTypes.hint: If specified, the spell cast will either trigger a to-hit roll or a saving throw roll prompt.

morale.name: Morale Check
morale.description: Monsters, Retainers, Hirelings and NPCs roll Morale Checks. Anyone needing to make a saving throw vs. an ongoing effect does so now.

movement.name: Movement
movement.description: Characters who choose to move do so now.

missile.name: Missile Combat
missile.description: Characters using missile and thrown weapons make their attacks.

magic.name: Magic
magic.description: Characters casting spells or using magic items do so now.

melee.name: Hand-to-Hand Combat
melee.description: Characters fighting hand-to-hand make their attacks.

nothing.name: Nothing
nothing.description: Combatant does absolutely nothing this round. No move, no attack, no nothing.

moveOnly.name: Move Only
moveOnly.description: Combatant is moving and not attacking this round. This is not a 'Retreat'.

readyWeapon.name: Ready Weapon
readyWeapon.description: Combatant is readying their weapon this round. They may also move at normal speed.

throw.name: Throw
throw.description: Combatant throws a suitable weapon, applying Dexterity and magic bonuses to the attack roll and Strength and magic bonuses to damage, provided the target is within range.

fire.name: Fire/Shoot
fire.description: Combatant uses a ranged weapon, such as a bow or breath weapon, provided the target is within the weaponâ€™s range.

spell.name: Cast Spell
spell.description: Combatant casts a memorized spell. Monsters use this action for magical attacks that aren't ranged or melee.

magicItem.name: Magic Item
magicItem.description: Combatant activates a non-weapon magical item, such as a potion, wand, ring, or the passive ability of another magical item.

attack.name: Attack
attack.description: Combatant makes a melee attack, adding Strength and magic bonuses to both the attack roll and damage.

withdrawal.name: Withdrawal
withdrawal.description: Combatant backs away from an enemy at 5 feet per round, attacking only if the enemy follows and moves into range during its movement phase.

retreat.name: Retreat
retreat.description: Combatant flees from melee at more than half their speed, losing shield AC bonuses and giving enemies a +2 bonus to attack them in that round.

lance.name: Lance Attack
lance.description: Combatant on charging mount performs a lance attack, gaining Strength and magic bonuses and dealing double damage if the mount charges at least 20 yards.

multiAttack.name: Multi-Attack
multiAttack.description: Combatant makes multiple attacks per round, which can include any combination of attacks, throws, disarms, or lance attacks.

setSpear.name: Set vs Charge
setSpear.description: Combatant braces a spear, pike, or similar weapon against a charging enemy, gaining Strength and magic bonuses and dealing double damage on a successful hit.

smash.name: Smash
smash.description: Combatant makes a powerful attack with a -5 penalty to the attack roll; if it hits, they add their full Strength score, along with Strength and magic bonuses, to the weapon's normal damage.

parry.name: Parry
parry.description: Combatant blocks incoming melee and thrown attacks for an entire round, causing all enemies to take a -4 penalty on their attack rolls against them.

disarm.name: Disarm
disarm.description: Combatant disarms an opponent by hitting without damage; if the target fails a Dexterity check, they drop their weapon.

shove.name: Shove
shove.description: The Shove Maneuver allows a combatant to replace its attack to push a target back or aside, using size, strength, and momentum to determine success.

guard.name: Guard
guard.description: The Guard maneuver allows a combatant to hold their melee attack until the end of an opponent's movement phase, striking if the opponent moves within range.

unarmed.name: Unarmed Combat
unarmed.description: Unarmed combat includes striking and wrestling. The defender does not have to engage in unarmed combat and may still attack with their melee weapon.

dodge.name: Dodge
dodge.description: When a fighter chooses this combat option, they do not attack at all and instead focus entirely on avoiding incoming attacks. Their AC increases by 5 against one specific attack they choose to evade. Against any other attack they are aware of, their AC increases by 3. Against any other attack they are not aware of, their AC increases by 1. This AC bonus lasts until the end of the round, and at the beginning of the next round, it is no longer in effect.

FADE.rollWithCtrl:
Roll {name} check.

Click to roll. Ctrl-click to roll without mod.
FADE.name: Name

Encumbrance.Hint: Enable automatic tracking of encumbrance and the calculation of movement rates. The Armor Only setting calculates movement based on armor weight. Classic sets a max load of 1,600 coins, tracks armor, weapons and loot weight, while adding 80 coins for adventuring gear and having four movement rates. Dark Dungeons assumes a max load of 2,400 coins, tracks weight of all items carried and has five movement rates.
Encumbrance.Name: Encumbrance Tracking

EncMax.Hint: The maximum amount a character may carry, in coins, and still be able to move.
EncMax.Hint2: The maximum amount, in coins, that can be carried while still able to move.
EncMax.Name: Encumbrance Max

Theme.Hint: Dark mode features a dark backround with light text and light mode features a light background with dark text.
Theme.Name: Theme

max.name: Max. Move Speed
max.hint:
Max ground speed per turn.

Movement distances are measured in feet when indoors and in yards when outdoors.

maxFlight.name: Max. Secondary Speed
maxFlight.hint:
Max secondary movement speed per turn.

Secondary movement can be any other type of movement the creature is capable of besides ground movement. Movement distances are measured in feet when indoors and in yards when outdoors.

formula.name: Initiative Formula
formula.hint: Define the formula used to calculate initiative.

mode.name: Initiative Mode
mode.hint: Choose between group-based or individual-based initiative. Individual (simplified) mode orders solely by initiative roll plus any modifiers. Individual mode adds the 2-handed weapon rule, making 2-handed weapon users lose initiative. Individual (combat checklist) mode combines individual initiative with the combat checklist order when declared actions are enabled. Group (combat checklist) mode groups combatants by token disposition and also sorts within a group by the declared action, if declared actions are enabled.

nextRound.name: Initiative Next Round Mode
nextRound.hint: Decide what will occur when the next round is activated in the combat tracker..

abilities.name: Abreviated ability names.
abilities.hint: Use abbreviations for character sheet abilities score labels.

saves.name: Short saving throw names.
saves.hint: Use short names for saving throws on the character sheet.

declaredActions.name: Declared Actions
declaredActions.hint: Enable declared actions for encounters. Declared actions are recommended if the combat checklist is used in the combat tracker.

collapseState.name: Remember Collapse State
collapseState.hint: When enabled, the item lists will remember their collapse state individually for each character.

logChanges.name: Log Character Sheet Changes
logChanges.hint: If enabled, logs character sheet changes to the GM via chat. This can be useful for troubleshoot issues.

weaponMastery.name: Weapon Mastery
weaponMastery.hint: If enabled, weapon mastery rules will be used.

toHitSystem.name: To-Hit System
toHitSystem.hint: The To-Hit System determines how attack rolls are handled and also what armor class system is used (AC vs AAC). THAC0 Only system does not use an attack matrix, but instead a simple calculation of the THAC0 value minus the target's AC. Classic system makes use of an attack matrix and THAC0 supporting up to level 25 and AC ranged from -19 to 19. Classic treats natural 1s as fails and 20s as hits, regardless of modifiers AC. Heroic Combat Matrix harkens back to RPGS of the 90s and scales up to level 36 and AC ranged from -99 to 19. Dark Dungeons uses the system from the Dark Dungeons game. AAC and Attack Bonus is similar to THAC0, but features ascending armor class where the higher the AC value, the greater the defensive capability.

abilityScoreModSystem.name: Ability Score Modifier System
abilityScoreModSystem.hint: The Ability Score Modifier System determines how ability score modifiers are calculated. Dark Dungeons is going to be compatible with many 'Basic/Expert' game system and is the default. Simple provides a simple +1 bonus on scores 15 and above while applying a -1 penalty on scores at or below 6.

monsterAbilityScores.name: Monster Ability Scores
monsterAbilityScores.hint: If enabled, the monster sheet will have ability scores, just like the character sheet. Select 'Without Modifier' option to ignore ability score modifiers. Select 'With Modifier' to include ability score modifiers. Including the modifiers will not only display them on the sheet, but also include them in die rolls, such as bonuses to attack and damage rolls.

roundDurationSec.name: Round Duration
roundDurationSec.hint: The number of seconds a round represent in game time.

turnDurationSec.name: Turn Duration
turnDurationSec.hint: The number of seconds a turn represents in the game. It is utilized by the turn tracker and often represents a duration of ten minutes, although this may vary. It is important to clarify that this definition of a turn is different from the turns tracked in combat.

showExplorationTarget.name: Show Exploration Target
showExplorationTarget.hint: Shows the target roll value on the character sheet if enabled.
